intro: Paederia microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed paederia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine and thrives in humid, tropical environments. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. The plant is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
